name: Bouncybox
tagline: A jQuery plug-in that lets you create a dialog that will bounce its way in and out!
body:
# Welcome to BouncyBox!

**Bouncy box** is a light-weight jQuery plug-in which enables you to create contents that will have a bouncing animation as it enters and exits the screen.

_In other words, they will go like **bounce**! and **bounce**! and **bounce** like a **ball**!_

***

## Methods

* **bouncyBoxRegister()**
* **bouncyBox()**
* **bouncyBoxDismiss()**


### [bouncyBoxRegister()](#)
**Description**  
This method initializes the element(s) to be used with the `bouncyBox()` method. This method simply reposition the target element(s) to the initial position when `bouncyBox()` method is used. It is best to invoke this method to the target element(s) right after the page has been loaded(`ready()`).  

**Syntax**  
`$(selector).bouncyBoxRegister()`  

**Parameters**  
none  

**Return Value**  
Returns a jQuery object  

**Example**  
`$("#selector1,#selector2").bouncyBoxRegister();`  




### [bouncyBox()](#)
**Description**  
Performs the bounce animation to the target element.  

**Syntax**  
`$(selector).bouncyBox([speed])`  
`$(selector).bouncyBox([callback])`  
`$(selector).bouncyBox([speed,callback])`  

**Parameters**  
**speed** (integer)- _Sets the speed or duration of the animation. The lower the value, the faster the animation._  
**callback** (function) - _A function that will be invoked right after the animation has completed._  

**Return Value**  
Returns a jQuery object  

**Examples**  
_Example 1:  No parameter_  
`$("#selector1").bouncyBox();`  
_Example 2:  Speed parameter_  
`$("#selector1").bouncyBox(500);`  
_Example 3: Callback function parameter_  

    $("#selector1").bouncyBox(function(){
        alert("Done!");
    })

_Example 4:Speed and Callback parameter_  

    $("#selector1").bouncyBox(500,function(){
        alert("Done!");
    })

### [bouncyBoxDismiss()](#)
**Description**  
Hides back the target element by bouncing it away. This is the opposite to `bouncyBox()` method.

**Syntax**  
`$(selector).bouncyBoxDissmiss([speed])`  

**Parameters**  
**speed** (integer)- _Sets the speed or duration of the animation. The lower the value, the faster the animation._  

**Return Value**  
Returns a jQuery object  

**Example**  
`$("#selector1").bouncyBoxDismiss();`  

***
## Demo
A quick demo can be found at: [http://iwisdomsky.tk/bouncy-box](http://iwisdomsky.tk/bouncy-box)

You can also visit our github [repository](https://github.com/WisdomSky/BouncyBox) for the demo source.
